keyword: calories in gin and tonic water
title: Calories in Gin and Tonic
meta_description: Discover calories in gin and tonic water for a standard serving, including carbs, sugars, alcohol content, and tweaks for lower-cal versions.
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 oz (44 ml) gin at 40% ABV, 4 oz (118 ml) regular tonic water, no lime or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, tonic type (regular vs. diet), and additions like lime or garnishes. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard gin and tonic has ~145 kcal, mostly from alcohol and tonic sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use diet tonic water instead of regular
Add a splash of lime juice (1 tsp)

faqs.q: How many calories in gin and tonic water?
faqs.a: About 145 kcal for one standard serving with 1.5 oz gin and 4 oz tonic.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in gin and tonic?
faqs.a: Yes, ~10.5 g carbs from tonic sugars; gin has none.

faqs.q: Calories in gin and tonic with diet tonic?
faqs.a: Drops to ~95 kcal, as diet tonic has 0 sugars.
Yes, ~97 kcal per 1.5 oz from alcohol; no carbs, fats, or proteins.

faqs.q: How does tonic water affect calories in gin and tonic?
faqs.a: Regular tonic adds ~48 kcal from sugars; opt for diet to save ~50 kcal.
